gettingHere: Access details will be confirmed during launch.
bestSeasons: Late spring through early autumn, when cedar and juniper are vibrant and water is calm, yet before the busiest summer weeks.
accessibility: Trail surfaces are natural; we recommend sturdy walking shoes and we provide soft-grip poles. Please disclose mobility needs when confirming your reservation so we can adapt stations.
whatToBring: Layered clothing for shifting coastal breezes
Reusable water vessel (stay hydrated without single-use plastics)
Compact rain shell and sun protection

etiquette.question: How should I prepare emotionally?
etiquette.answer: Treat the trail as a shared living space. Move slowly, listen first, and allow silence to balance the conversation.

etiquette.question: Is photography allowed?
etiquette.answer: Yes, but keep it gentleâ€”no flash, keep movements quiet, and focus on atmosphere rather than people. Respect privacy during storytelling moments.

etiquette.question: Can I bring food?
etiquette.answer: We ask you to refrain from snacking while on the active trail. Light refreshments may be shared in the Gathering Stone after the walk.
